title: Ticket #5242: condor_urlfetch withing main config file on windows
description:
Though condor_urlfetch works fine from the windows command line when used withing the main config file for LOCAL_CONFIG_FILE we here about a bad temp file and an error 5 being returned. Should command line usage not specify the cache file, we here about gpu_discovery having an issue followed by a program exit.

To set up a python based web server, be in the directory you want to serve files from and then execute the following: 

python -m SimpleHTTPServer      # serves from port 8000
python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8080 # serves from port 8080

see also #5211
remarks:
2015-Sep-09 22:19:04 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: Looks good

Code now matches documentation, no version history needed.
check_ins: 2015-Aug-28 13:57   Check-in [45752]: fix various problems with condor_urlfetch. #5242 -$(SUBSYSTEM) should not be required the cache_file should not be required failure to fetch from HTTP is not an error unless there is no cache file. (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
